meanings.definition: The state of being composed of multiple cells.
meanings.sent1: The multicellularity of the organism allows for specialized cell functions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study multicellularity to understand how cells work together in living organisms.
meanings.sent3: The multicellularity of the sponge makes it a great team player in the ocean ecosystem.
meanings.sent4: In a bustling city, the multicellularity of buildings creates a vibrant skyline.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of multicellularity lies in the harmony of diverse cells working as one.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of having many cells.
meanings.sent1: The multicellularity of the tumor indicated its rapid growth.
meanings.sent2: The multicellularity of the plant root system helps it absorb nutrients efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The multicellularity of the cake made it a hit at the party, with each layer adding to its deliciousness.
meanings.sent4: In a dense forest, the multicellularity of trees creates a lush canopy overhead.
meanings.sent5: The multicellularity of the coral reef forms a colorful and diverse underwater community.
